lines.text: Something's been bugging me...
W-well, unless it's important, keep your mouth-
Shoot, Seeker.
Thanks, Leo.
So- I was thinking this before, but how come the <c=#0000FF>Stop Wizard</c> tried to kill Slick with <c=#0000FF>Flesh to Stone?</c>
S-self-defense, I'd imagine...
No, but- I mean, we're assuming he died from burning to death, and that he burned to death when the spell was cast.
But- that only happened because he was under the effect of <c=#0000FF>Mass Arrest Momentum.</c> So wasn't he already dealt with?
I see...
Like, the guy's already frozen and burning to death- why use a risky spell like that to finish him off?
It just doesn't line up!
...Or at least, it looks like it doesn't l-line up, if you're- if you're a simpleton.
...What is it now?
That <c=#0000FF>Mass Arrest Momentum</c> spell can be broken, depending on the target.
Think about it- Slick- Slick breaks free, h-he points the gun, the wizard doesn't want to risk- risk him breaking free again...
And he's panicking, doesn't think about the fire... the scenario is natural.
Kind of a just-so story, but I guess that flies...
Hmph. Your- your petty objections only fuel my logic.
Alright, Whydah. You win this round. Pack it in.
